intro: Opuntia nejapensis, commonly known as the Nejapensis prickly pear, is a species of cactus native to Mexico. It is characterized by its flat, fleshy stems that are typically green and covered in spines. The plant produces yellow or orange flowers during the spring and summer months. Its fruit, known as a tuna, is edible and has a sweet, tangy flavor. Opuntia nejapensis is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food and shelter for various wildlife.
